triples.name: AdaBoost
triples.relevance: AdaBoost is the core boosting algorithm used as the main ensemble method for heart disease classification.

triples.name: Cross-validation (statistics)
triples.relevance: K-fold cross-validation is used for model evaluation and validation during the classifier development.

triples.name: Cardiovascular disease
triples.relevance: Heart disease detection is the primary medical diagnosis task being addressed in this paper.

triples.name: Ensemble learning
triples.relevance: Ensemble methods combining multiple classifiers form the foundation of the proposed approach.

triples.name: Naive Bayes classifier
triples.relevance: Naive Bayes is one of the base classifiers used in the ensemble approach for heart disease classification.

triples.name: Decision tree learning
triples.relevance: Decision trees are used as another base classifier in the ensemble, forming the foundation for Random Forest.

triples.name: Synthetic minority oversampling technique
triples.relevance: SMOTE is employed as a preprocessing technique to handle class imbalance in the heart disease dataset.

triples.name: Random forest
triples.relevance: Random Forest is combined with AdaBoost to create the AdaBoost-Random Forest ensemble achieving 95.47% accuracy.

triples.name: Boosting (machine learning)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel application of boosting techniques by combining AdaBoost with Random Forest for heart disease detection.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the overarching methodology used to develop the heart disease detection system.
